New Records: Corey Seager had four hits, including a tiebreaking single in the ninth inning to help the Texas Rangers beat the Chicago White Sox 4-3 on August 29, 2024.
Key Match Events: Travis Jankowski made a leaping catch in the ninth inning to rob Andrew Vaughn of a potential game-winning home run.
Corey Seager drove in the decisive run with a bloop single in the top of the ninth inning.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was suspended due to a fast-moving storm the previous night, leading to a delay and eventual resumption.
Texas improved to 6-0 against Chicago this season.
Post-Match Reflections: Rangers manager Bruce Bochy discussed adjustments due to the lack of fans in the stands after the game suspension.
White Sox interim manager Grady Sizemore expressed frustration over the loss but acknowledged the Rangers' key moments.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Texas Rangers won both games of the doubleheader against the Chicago White Sox.
The White Sox were close to their franchise record of 106 losses, currently at 31-103.
Others: Marcus Semien had a leadoff walk after the game resumed, contributing to the Rangers' win.
Rangers left-hander Andrew Heaney allowed five hits in five innings but competed effectively.
